newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - W.R. Grace gains ground.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - W.R. Grace gains ground.

text.p: W.R. Grace gained a point in after-hours trade on Thursday after announcing it would merge its packaging unit with Sealed Air in a deal valued at $5 billion, traders said.
Shares in Grace stock, which closed at 68-1/4, rose to 69-1/4 after the bell, according to dealers who otherwise characterized the trading session as quiet.
The packaging and chemical supplier also said it would create a new publicly traded company with annual sales in excess of $2.5 billion.
Sealed Air did not trade after-hours.

Office supplier Staples Inc, meanwhile, fell a fraction during after-hours trade after posting second quarter earnings that were little changed from year-ago levels after merger-related costs. The company traded at 25-11/16, down 1/8.
Staples posted earnings of $0.12 per share before merger-related costs and $0.09 per share including the costs, compared with $0.09 per share a year ago.
Elsewhere, McAfee Associates shares lost almost a dollar for reasons that were not immediately known.
The computer software producer closed unofficially at 62-3/8 after regular-hours trade and then slipped to 61-1/2 after the bell, dealers said.
"I see no news, but it's trading down," a trader said of McAfee stock.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 7,900, compared with 2,100 for the previous day, and session two volume was 1.7 million compared with 6.4 million.
